professionalism.title: Billable hours
professionalism.description:
Customer hours that are billable.

Mandatory for leveling up.

Need to have at least 515 billable hours during the quarter.

Not possible to gain more than 515 points for this achievement, but hours are passed from level to level, meaning if you didn't level up the previous quarter, the billable hours from that quarter are passed to this quarter.

For reservists (miluim) there is a special note about this item, detailed in the 'Guidelines' section.

professionalism.title: Weekly reports
professionalism.description:
Weekly reports sent on a weekly basis to the relevant people (usually team leader, group leader, customer focal points and the weeklies email).

Mandatory for leveling up.

Team leader will approve at the end of each quarter that weekly reports were sent on a regular basis during the quarter.

tech.title: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner
tech.description: Foundational understanding of AWS Cloud concepts, services, and terminology. Essential first step for AWS certification journey.
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified AI Practitioner
tech.description: Foundational knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning on AWS. Master AI services and best practices.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, multiple response, and new question types
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified SysOps Administrator
tech.description: Deploy, manage, and operate scalable systems on AWS. Master monitoring, logging, and troubleshooting AWS environments.
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified Developer
tech.description: Build and deploy applications on AWS. Master AWS SDKs, serverless technologies, and development best practices.
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified Solutions Architect
tech.description: Design and deploy scalable, highly available systems on AWS. Master AWS services, security, and architectural best practices.
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified Data Engineer
tech.description: Design and implement data engineering solutions on AWS. Master data pipelines, analytics, and ML workflows.
tech.prerequisites: None (2-3 years data engineering experience recommended)
tech.retakePolicy: Standard AWS retake policy applies

tech.title: AWS Certified Machine Learning Engineer
tech.description: Build, train, and deploy machine learning models using AWS services. Master ML engineering and MLOps practices.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, multiple response, ordering, matching, case study
tech.prerequisites: None (1+ year ML engineering experience recommended)
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional
tech.description: Design complex distributed systems on AWS. Master advanced architectural patterns and enterprise-scale solutions.
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified DevOps Engineer Professional
tech.description: Implement and manage continuous delivery systems on AWS. Master advanced DevOps practices and automation.
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified Advanced Networking Speciality
tech.description: Design and implement advanced AWS networking solutions. Master VPC, hybrid connectivity, and network security.
tech.retakePolicy: Standard AWS retake policy applies

tech.title: AWS Certified Machine Learning Speciality
tech.description: Build, train, tune, and deploy machine learning models using AWS services. Master ML workflows and production deployment.
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: AWS Certified Security Speciality
tech.description: Secure AWS workloads and implement comprehensive security solutions. Master AWS security services and best practices.
tech.prerequisites: None (5+ years IT security experience recommended)
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait period, no limit on attempts

tech.title: Azure Administrator Associate
tech.description: Manage Azure subscriptions, implement storage solutions, and configure virtual networks. Essential for cloud infrastructure management.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, drag-and-drop, case studies, performance-based
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait after first attempt, 14 days after second

tech.title: Azure Developer
tech.description: Build applications and services on Microsoft Azure. Master Azure development tools and services.
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait after first attempt, 14 days after second

tech.title: Azure Fundamentals
tech.description: Foundational knowledge of cloud concepts and Azure services. Perfect entry point for Azure learning journey.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, mark reviews, drag-and-drop, case studies
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait after first attempt

tech.title: Azure Data Scientist
tech.description: Design and implement data science solutions on Azure. Master machine learning workflows and model deployment.
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait after first attempt, 14 days after second

tech.title: Azure Security Engineer
tech.description: Implement security controls and threat protection. Manage identity and access, and protect data and applications on Azure.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, drag-and-drop, labs, active screen
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait after first attempt, 14 days after second

tech.title: Azure Solutions Architect Expert
tech.description: Design solutions on Microsoft Azure. Master advanced architectural patterns and enterprise-scale solutions.
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait after first attempt

tech.title: Azure DevOps Engineer Expert
tech.description: Design and implement DevOps practices on Azure. Master continuous integration and continuous deployment.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice single and multiple response
tech.prerequisites: Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104) OR Azure Developer Associate (AZ-204) required
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait after first attempt, 14 days after second

tech.title: GCP Associate Cloud Engineer
tech.description: Deploy applications, monitor operations, and manage enterprise solutions on Google Cloud Platform.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, multiple select, case studies
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days wait after first attempt, 60 days after second

tech.title: GCP Cloud Database Engineer
tech.description: Design, create, manage, and optimize database solutions on Google Cloud Platform.

tech.title: GCP Professional Cloud DevOps Engineer
tech.description: Implement and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies on Google Cloud Platform.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, multiple select, case studies, drag and drop
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days after first, 60 days after second, 1 year after third

tech.title: GCP Cloud Architect Professional
tech.description: Design, develop, and manage robust, secure, scalable, highly available, and dynamic solutions to drive business objectives.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, case studies (20-30% of exam)
tech.retakePolicy: 14 days after first, 60 days after second, 1 year after third

tech.title: GCP Machine Learning Engineer
tech.description: Design, build, and productionize ML models to solve business challenges using Google Cloud technologies.

tech.title: GCP Cloud Network Engineer
tech.description: Implement and manage network architectures in Google Cloud Platform.

tech.title: GCP Data Engineer
tech.description: Design, build, operationalize, secure, and monitor data processing systems with a particular emphasis on security and compliance.
tech.retakePolicy: 4 attempts in 2 years

tech.title: GCP Security Engineer
tech.description: Configure access within a cloud solution environment. Design, develop, and manage secure workloads and infrastructure.

tech.title: CKA - Certified Kubernetes Administrator
tech.description: Demonstrate the skills, knowledge and competency to perform the responsibilities of Kubernetes administrators.
tech.questionTypes: Performance-based tasks in live Kubernetes environment
tech.retakePolicy: 24-hour wait period between attempts

tech.title: CKS - Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist
tech.description: Demonstrate competence on a broad range of best practices for securing container-based applications and Kubernetes platforms during build, deployment and runtime.
tech.questionTypes: Performance-based tasks in live Kubernetes environment
tech.retakePolicy: 24-hour wait period between attempts

tech.title: HashiCorp Terraform Associate
tech.description: Infrastructure as Code with Terraform. Automate cloud resource provisioning and management across multiple providers.
tech.questionTypes: Multiple choice, multiple answer, true/false, text match
tech.prerequisites: None (recommended: basic concepts and skills with Terraform)
tech.retakePolicy: 7-day wait between attempts, max 3 attempts per year

tech.title: Terraform Authoring and Operations Professional
tech.description: Advanced Terraform expertise for production environments. Master complex configuration authoring, operations, and collaborative workflows with performance-based lab scenarios.
tech.questionTypes: Performance-based lab scenarios and multiple choice
tech.retakePolicy: One free retake within 3 months, then 18-month wait to retake

tech.title: HashiCorp Vault Associate
tech.description: Secrets management with HashiCorp Vault. Secure, store, and tightly control access to secrets and encryption keys.
tech.prerequisites: None (recommended: basic concepts and skills with Vault)
tech.retakePolicy: 7-day wait between attempts, max 3 attempts per year

tech.title: GitHub Foundations
tech.description: Foundational knowledge of Git, GitHub, and collaborative software development practices.
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait, then 14 days between retakes, max 5 attempts

tech.title: GitHub Copilot
tech.description: AI-powered coding assistant fundamentals. Master GitHub Copilot for enhanced productivity and code generation.
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait, then 14 days between retakes, max 5 attempts

tech.title: GitHub Advanced Security
tech.description: Advanced security features and practices for secure software development on GitHub.
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait, then 14 days between retakes, max 5 attempts

tech.title: GitHub Actions
tech.description: Automate software development workflows with GitHub Actions. Master CI/CD pipelines and workflow automation.
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait, then 14 days between retakes, max 5 attempts

tech.title: GitHub Administration
tech.description: Enterprise GitHub administration and management. Master user management, security policies, and organizational governance.
tech.retakePolicy: 24 hours wait, then 14 days between retakes, max 5 attempts

tech.title: Prometheus Certified Associate (PCA)
tech.description: Time-series monitoring with Prometheus. Collect metrics, create alerts, and build observability into your systems.
tech.retakePolicy: One free retake included

tech.title: GitOps Fundamentals
tech.description: Foundational GitOps principles and practices. Understand declarative configuration and Git-based workflows.
tech.retakePolicy: Unlimited retakes

tech.title: GitOps at Scale
tech.description: Enterprise-scale GitOps implementation. Master multi-cluster deployments and advanced GitOps patterns.
tech.retakePolicy: Unlimited retakes

tech.title: Certified GitOps Associate (CGOA)
tech.description: Demonstrate understanding of GitOps principles, terminology, and best practices for setting up GitOps managed software systems.
tech.retakePolicy: One free retake included

tech.title: FinOps Certified Practitioner (FOCP)
tech.description: Cloud financial management fundamentals. Master cost optimization and financial accountability in cloud environments.
tech.retakePolicy: 3 attempts within 1 year

tech.title: FinOps Certified Engineer
tech.description: Technical FinOps implementation and automation. Master tools and practices for cloud cost engineering.
tech.retakePolicy: 3 attempts within 1 year

tech.title: FinOps Certified Professional
tech.description: Advanced FinOps leadership and strategy. Master enterprise-scale financial operations and cloud cost management.
tech.prerequisites: Active FOCP certificate + 6 months FinOps experience
tech.retakePolicy: Included in course price

tech.title: CompTIA Network+ ce
tech.description: Networking fundamentals and infrastructure. Master network configuration, management, and troubleshooting.
tech.prerequisites: Recommended: CompTIA A+ and 9-12 months experience
tech.retakePolicy: Contact CompTIA for retake policy

tech.title: Professional Scrum Master I (PSM-I)
tech.description: Scrum framework mastery and servant leadership. Master agile practices and team facilitation.
tech.retakePolicy: USD $150 per attempt

knowledge-unlock.title: Case Study
knowledge-unlock.description: A case study article that shares knowledge of a case that happened. Can be internal (notion). Must be published to all develeap so people will learn from others. Examples: Case Studies Collection →

knowledge-unlock.title: Public Lecture
knowledge-unlock.description: Any lecture outside develeap, i.e - Lishka, meetup, YouTube

knowledge-unlock.title: Publish external article (outside magazine)
knowledge-unlock.description: Any article that is published to the world. i.e Medium, outside the develeap magazine

knowledge-unlock.title: Publish an article to develeap magazine
knowledge-unlock.description:
Article that is published to develeap magazine.

Definition of Done: After technical review and Shani's review. If the article has not passed those 2 reviews - it is not a done achievement (as the review is part of the learning process and the achievement).

If the article has been posted also outside the magazine (i.e Medium) then only the magazine points will count (no duplication for points receiving).

Review is mandatory, and you'll get points also for doing the review (reviewer and reviewee), meaning eventually this achievement worths 60 points.

knowledge-unlock.title: Recording lecture for course
knowledge-unlock.description: Record a single lecture for bootcamp course

knowledge-unlock.title: Creating Course chapter
knowledge-unlock.description: Record a full bootcamp course chapter

knowledge-unlock.title: (AWS) case study
knowledge-unlock.description:
A public article (case study) about a project done over AWS with the customer name inside.

Can be also for not AWS only, but must be published.

In coordination with GL.

knowledge-unlock.title: Podcast management
knowledge-unlock.description: Ongoing every DCR level as long as you're running and managing a Podcast at develeap, and releasing at least 6 chapters per level.

collaboration.title: Interview Training (interviewer)
collaboration.description: An internal interview training. The interviewer has to interview non-bootcamp employees with coordination of the TL

collaboration.title: DevOps candidates review
collaboration.description: DevOps candidate (non-bootcamp) interview. Coordinate with HR.

collaboration.title: Peer Code Reviewee
collaboration.description:
A code review from any develeap employee - should be documented by email (by the reviewer) with details of what has been covered in the review and what is needed to be fixed.

The review can be done to code, public articles, case-study and architecture designs.

collaboration.title: Peer Code Reviewer
collaboration.description:
Do a code review to anyone at develeap - should be documented by email (by the reviewer) with details of what has been covered in the review and what is needed to be fixed.

The review can be done to code, public articles, case studies and architecture designs.

collaboration.title: Architecture: Analyze, Create, Mentor & Present
collaboration.description: Outside your original project - analyze requirements and create architecture. After that mentor & present with the project main person the work that has been done.

collaboration.title: Buddies
collaboration.description: Be a success buddy for a new develeap employee (coordinated with a TL)

collaboration.title: AWS Hero
collaboration.description: Become an AWS Hero - a recognition for technical experts and thought leaders in the AWS community. AWS Heroes Program →

collaboration.title: Internal project management
collaboration.description: For creating an internal project in develeap with the involvement of 1 other person at least, outside of your role scope (should be extra). Needs to be approved by GL.

collaboration.title: AWS service delivery process
collaboration.description: AWS Service Delivery process, coordinated with Partnerships department (Hadar)

collaboration.title: DevOps Evening Course Q&A
collaboration.description: Coordinated by education, TL and GL, manage a Q&A evening course

collaboration.title: Bootcamp Q&A session
collaboration.description: Coordinated by education, TL and GL, manage a Q&A session for bootcamp

collaboration.title: Bootcamp interview
collaboration.description: DevOps Bootcamp candidate (bootcamp) interview. Coordinate with Education.

extra.title: Points from previous level
extra.description: Points from previous level, that were not used in the previous level-up.

extra.title: Certification renewal
extra.description:
Renewal of a previously achieved certification.
Worths 25% the original certification.

extra.title: Certification circle
extra.description:
Get certifications in groups, help each other, get motivated and get extra points for grouping up.
The more people are in the circle, more extra points each will get.
Reservists (miluim) are more than welcome to join, giving extra 5% points (up to twice in each circle).

Applicable for certifications worth 130 points and higher.

* Select total people count in the people input, and how many OF THEM are reservists in the 3rd input. (if you are a group of 6, where 2 are reservists and 4 are not, in the inputs select 6 and 2+)

roadmaps.title: DevOps & Cloud Associate
roadmaps.description: Master foundational DevOps and cloud skills with HashiCorp Terraform Associate, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, CKA - Certified Kubernetes Administrator, and GitHub Actions. Perfect entry point for cloud-native careers.
roadmaps.questionTypes: Mixed: Multiple choice, hands-on labs, practical exercises
roadmaps.prerequisites: Basic cloud and DevOps knowledge recommended

roadmaps.title: DevOps & Cloud Expert
roadmaps.description: Advanced DevOps and cloud expertise with HashiCorp Terraform Associate, AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional, CKS - Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist, and GitHub Administration. For senior engineers and architects.
roadmaps.questionTypes: Mixed: Multiple choice, hands-on labs, scenario-based
roadmaps.prerequisites: DevOps & Cloud Associate or equivalent experience

roadmaps.title: Multi Cloud Associate
roadmaps.description: Comprehensive multi-cloud foundation with AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Administrator Associate, and GCP Associate Cloud Engineer. Master the big three cloud platforms.
roadmaps.questionTypes: Multiple choice, case studies, hands-on components

roadmaps.title: Multi Cloud Expert
roadmaps.description: Elite multi-cloud expertise with AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional, Azure Solutions Architect Expert, and GCP Cloud Architect Professional. For enterprise cloud architects.
roadmaps.questionTypes: Complex scenarios, case studies, architectural design
roadmaps.prerequisites: Multi Cloud Associate or equivalent professional experience

roadmaps.title: GitHub Expert
roadmaps.description: Complete GitHub mastery with GitHub Foundations, GitHub Copilot, GitHub Actions, GitHub Administration, and GitHub Advanced Security. Master the entire GitHub ecosystem for enterprise development.
roadmaps.questionTypes: Multiple choice, hands-on labs, practical scenarios

roadmaps.title: K8S Expert
roadmaps.description: Master Kubernetes administration and security with CKA - Certified Kubernetes Administrator and CKS - Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist. Essential for container orchestration expertise.

roadmaps.title: AWS Expert - Pro
roadmaps.description: AWS Professional-level expertise with AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional and AWS Certified DevOps Engineer Professional. Master enterprise AWS architecture and advanced DevOps practices.
roadmaps.questionTypes: Complex scenarios, case studies, multiple choice

roadmaps.title: AWS Expert - Specialist
roadmaps.description: AWS Specialty expertise with AWS Certified Security Speciality, AWS Certified Advanced Networking Speciality, and AWS Certified Machine Learning Speciality. Deep specialization in critical AWS domains for experts.
roadmaps.questionTypes: Deep technical scenarios, specialized case studies
roadmaps.prerequisites: AWS Professional or relevant Associate certifications

guidelines.title: DCR Goals & Objectives
points: Continuously stretch our abilities & skills, and always be at the front
Continuous Learning (CL) - stay updated with industry trends and technologies
Continuously increase our market value through skill development
Long-term career planning that remains dynamic and adaptable
Motivation and personal growth for all consultants
Support different types of consultants and various career paths

guidelines.title: General Program Rules
points: DCR is created for new employees at least 3 months after joining Develeap
Achievements completed before DCR creation do not count - we plan for the future
Each consultant creates an achievements backlog with their team leader
Achievements can be chosen from the general backlog or new ideas are welcome
Every achievement has its own 'price' (point value)
All achievements must be documented and shared with Team Leader
DCR work happens on personal time, not customer time (except billable hours and customer-specific achievements)

guidelines.title: Quarterly Celebration Points & Payouts
points: Q1 (January-March): Received in April salary, at the beginning of May
Q2 (April-June): Received in July salary, at the beginning of August
Q3 (July-September): Received in October salary, at the beginning of November
Q4 (October-December): Received in January salary, at the beginning of February
During celebration points, leveled-up consultants are celebrated and backlog is reset
Weekly reports are now mandatory - Team Leader approves proper submission at quarter end

guidelines.title: Level Up Process & Documentation
points: When you level up, you get a raise in the same quarter
Review achievements with Team Leader, then sent to Group Leader for approval
All achievements must have documentation links in the DCR sheet 'Document' column
Certifications: Credly certification badge or official certificate
Articles: Direct link to published article
Code reviews: Summary email or Notion page with link
Role expectations may vary between positions - discuss with Team Leader

guidelines.title: Points System & Level Requirements
points: Level 1-2: 850 points required for each level
Level 3-4: 1000 points required for each level
Level 5-6: 1200 points required for each level
Level 7-8: 1500 points required for each level
Level 9-10: 1700 points required for each level
Excess points are saved for the next level - points are never wasted!
Billable hours: Maximum 515 points, no rollover of excess hours
Billable hours calculated from level start date, not quarterly
Goals setting is cooperative between team member and Team Leader
Goals can be modified with Team Leader approval during the level

guidelines.title: Roadmaps & Certification Badges
points: Roadmap badges awarded for achieving groups of related certifications
Bonus points given when completing the final missing certification in a roadmap
If you already have all certifications in a roadmap, bonus points awarded immediately
Roadmaps help guide career development in specific technology areas

guidelines.title: Certification Circles
points: Study groups for certifications worth 130+ points
Must declare participation in the first month of each quarter
Bonus points distributed based on group size and completion percentage
Special bonus: Miluimnik participants add 5% extra points to all circle members (max 2 per circle)
Use the certification-circle form to announce and organize groups

guidelines.title: Miluim (Reservist) Special Conditions
points: Miluimniks get additional month (minimum) to achieve points and billable hours
Extension period can be longer if miluim service exceeds one month
Billable hours count for both quarters during miluim period
Raise occurs in the last month of extension period (any month of the year)
Possibility to level up twice in the same quarter without affecting next level
Miluimnik in certification-circle adds 5% bonus to all circle members

guidelines.title: Promoted Items & Bonus Points
points: Some items are promoted each quarter and receive ~10% bonus points
Promoted items are highlighted on the main page and in the catalog
Currently: All GCP certifications offer 10% bonus points
Promoted items help guide focus toward high-value learning opportunities

guidelines.title: Forms & Resources
points: Form 1: Use for suggesting new items to add to the DCR catalog
Form 2: Use for submitting and announcing certification-circles
All forms accessible through the 'Forms' section in the navigation menu
New achievement ideas are welcome and will be reviewed for inclusion

faq.question: When can I start the DCR program?
faq.answer: You can start the DCR program at least 3 months after joining Develeap. This waiting period allows you to settle in and understand the company culture before focusing on career development planning.

faq.question: Do achievements I completed before starting DCR count?
faq.answer: No, achievements completed before DCR creation do not count. The DCR program is designed for future planning and growth. We focus on setting goals and achieving them moving forward, not rewarding past accomplishments.

faq.question: How many points do I need to level up?
faq.answer: Point requirements are structured by level tiers: Level 1-2 requires 850 points each, Level 3-4 requires 1000 points each, Level 5-6 requires 1200 points each, Level 7-8 requires 1500 points each, and Level 9-10 requires 1700 points each. Remember that excess points carry forward to your next level!

faq.question: When do I get paid for leveling up?
faq.answer: Raises are paid in the same quarter you level up. The quarterly schedule is: Q1 (Jan-Mar) paid in April salary, Q2 (Apr-Jun) paid in July salary, Q3 (Jul-Sep) paid in October salary, Q4 (Oct-Dec) paid in January salary.

faq.question: What happens to extra points if I exceed my level requirement?
faq.answer: Great news - excess points are never wasted! For example, if you're at Level 3 (needing 1000 points) and achieve 1100 points, the extra 100 points are saved for Level 4. However, billable hours are capped at 515 points maximum with no rollover of excess hours.

faq.question: Can I work on DCR achievements during customer time?
faq.answer: No, DCR work should happen on personal time, not customer time. The exceptions are billable hours (which obviously happen during customer work) and customer-specific achievements like peer code reviews that naturally occur during client projects.

faq.question: What documentation do I need for achievements?
faq.answer: All achievements require documentation in the DCR sheet 'Document' column. Examples: Certifications need Credly badges or official certificates, articles need direct links, code reviews need summary emails or Notion pages with links.

faq.question: What are certification circles and how do they work?
faq.answer: Certification circles are study groups for certifications worth 130+ points. You must declare participation in the first month of each quarter. Bonus points are distributed based on group size and completion rates. Use the certification-circle form to organize groups.

faq.question: I'm doing miluim (military reserves) - are there special rules?
faq.answer: Yes! Miluimniks get at least one additional month to achieve points and billable hours. Your billable hours count for both quarters, and you can potentially level up twice in the same quarter. In certification circles, you add 5% extra points for all members.

faq.question: What are roadmap badges and how do I earn them?
faq.answer: Roadmap badges are bonus points awarded for completing groups of related certifications (like AWS or Azure certification paths). You get the bonus when you complete the final missing certification in a roadmap, or immediately if you already have all required certs.

faq.question: Can I change my achievement goals during a level?
faq.answer: Yes, goals setting is cooperative between you and your team leader. You can modify your goals with team leader approval during the level. The process is designed to be flexible and adapt to changing circumstances.

faq.question: Are weekly reports really mandatory now?
faq.answer: Yes, weekly reports are now mandatory for leveling up. Your team leader will approve at the end of each quarter that reports were sent consistently. This helps maintain communication and track progress throughout your DCR journey.

faq.question: What are promoted items and how do I know about them?
faq.answer: Some items receive ~10% bonus points each quarter and are highlighted on the main page and catalog. Currently, all GCP certifications offer 10% bonus points. Check the main page regularly for current promotions.

faq.question: How are billable hours calculated?
faq.answer: Billable hours are calculated from your level start date, not quarterly. You need a minimum of 515 hours per level (not per quarter), which counts toward your total points requirement (850-1700 depending on your target level). For example, if you leveled up April 1st and reach 515 hours by September end, you can still level up as it's calculated across the entire level period.

faq.question: Who approves my level up?
faq.answer: First, review your achievements with your Team Leader and plan your next achievements. After TL review, it gets sent to the Group Leader for final approval. Both mandatory items (billable hours and weekly reports) must be completed.

faq.question: How should I plan my points strategy for different levels?
faq.answer: Start by knowing your target level requirements: Early levels (1-2) need 850 points, Mid levels (3-4) need 1000 points, Advanced levels (5-6) need 1200 points, Expert levels (7-8) need 1500 points, and Master levels (9-10) need 1700 points. Remember that 515 points come from mandatory billable hours, so plan additional achievements accordingly. Use the Level-up Simulator to test different combinations!

forms.title: Suggest new item
forms.description: Suggest new certifications, courses, or achievements to be added to the DCR system.

forms.title: Announce certification-circle
forms.description: Announce and organize certification study groups with colleagues for bonus points.
